title: Mental Health Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Jersey City, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: They called and scheduled an interview. The interview was more informational, as they want to talk you through the role. Make sure to ask a lot of questions and take notes.
Interview Questions: How’d you hear about the role?

title: CCTV Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: Good to know if I ll be called by RWJ If after the interview I was not called and they desired to go with another candidate and to apply for a different posición
Interview Questions: When do I get hired by ?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was quick and organized. Heard back from the Human Resources department in a decent amount of time. Interviewed with People who played major roles in the livelihood od the workplace.
Interview Questions: Questions pertaining to you history, experience and future goals here at RWJBH

title: NICU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Livingston, NJ) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: 5 questions including: A time you spoke up for patient safety A time you went above and beyond An example of handling conflict Overall very kind, conversation based. Want to ensure dedication & competency and reduce turnover
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Brick, NJ) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview - lasted about 20 minutes. Was fairly quick and asked about 5 questions. Interviewer was really nice and seemed interested in my answers. Interview questions were pretty standard.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: ER Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Belleville, NJ) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Short, to the point, respectful. They were extremely clear of the expectations associated with the position. Both interviewers were professional yet open and even made a joke or two. There were a few trick questions that I messed up but....
Interview Questions: How would you calm an irate patient/family member.

title: Patient Access Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Jersey City, NJ) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: I checked in today at 9:38AM and waited until 12:30PM to be interviewed. Says a lot how little they value applicants time. Employees were disrespectful. 20 people waiting downstairs for HOURS to get called. The most sordid interview experience I ever had in my life. A little more professionalism guys & less racism
Interview Questions: What motivates you and why?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: Simple and the workers are all nice. The place is nice. The pay is great. The area is also very beautiful. The parking is easy. The cafe is nice the whole place in general is good
Interview Questions: What makes you perfect for this job

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview, first you see someone from HR department and then department manager. Interview overall was pretty average. They ask common sense questions, ask about your clinical experience etc. I believe I needed to pass a math test for the position as well (in HR department) but I can't really remember the details.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself

title: Medical Scribing Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (New Brunswick, NJ) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly, compassionate, and understanding. They asked me for my passions and why I chose their company. They started off with trying to get to know me personally instead of just bombarding me.
Interview Questions: what past experiences do you have? why RWJBH?

title: CCT RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: they had an open house and offered position on the spot, you get to see what specialties are open and available. schedule is flexible. good experience for those who want to go into medical field.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: The people there are very friendly, warm, and professional. The people made me feel comfortable during the interview. It was a really good experience. I really do not have any complaints about the interview process.
Interview Questions: What makes you a good fit for the job?

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: It was a group Interview of about 20 people. They went around and asked everyone the same questions. After the interview you met with individual managers and supervisors. You pretty much knew if you moved on to the next step of the process
Interview Questions: What previous experience do you have

title: Clinical Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions:
They get a group of 10-15 people together and go around one by one. The interviewer then chastises the people in the group if they don’t answer "properly" and tells them they’ll never get hired here or anywhere if they answer like that. She airs their business and judges where they went to school. She shared an anecdote that just made her seem awful. She insulted several of the people in my group. 

Second round involved meeting the team instead of the recruiter. They complained how my generation was lazy and didn’t want to work. I have never said no so fast when offered a job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health in May 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Quick response and interview process able
To meet director and team
Members.  Offer was made timely I had other interviews and it was a time consuming process this was seemless.  Including onboarding
Interview Questions: Experience level and goals for the future.

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial phone screening for 1st round.  Then there was  Goto Meeting Interview for 2nd round.  Lastly, there was an in person 3rd round.  This was followed by an extensive on-boarding process.  Then there is a panel review after 6 weeks.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do this?

title: Advanced Practice Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: Meet with head of hospitalist group after meeting with HUMAN RESOURCES. 7 days on and then 7 days off. No vacation time offered with this schedule.  Benefits are fair. Team is amazing however.
Interview Questions: Describe previous role and function

title: Senior Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions:
It took 3 months before I got called for an interview. The interview session mainly involved the interviewers talking about the job
It was overwhelming learning the details of the role
Interview Questions: What made you apply for the position

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Quick and Easy! I interviewed with the AVP and less than a week later I had an interview with the team and the offer was sent out. This is possibly the best interview process I have been through as I have been looking for a new role for approximately two years.
Interview Questions: How does your background assist with learning what's necessary for this role?

title: Remote Monitoring Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Newark, NJ) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call from an HR recruiter with Newark Beth Israel, and he scheduled me for an in-person interview the next day. The email he sent was very concise, with clear directions as to where to park and where the building was. That was the only good aspect of my experience with HR. My interview was scheduled for 10:00 am. I arrived at 09:50 and let the front desk HR employee know I was here. By 10:20, nobody came. I went up to the desk and asked if the person interviewing me was running late, the employee at the front desk stated the interviewer was just here and left for another meeting, but will be returning shortly. I let them know again that my interview was for 10:00, and I have been waiting for 30 minutes. I sat back down again. Finally, at 11:00, I went up to the desk and said that I will be leaving and I would not like to reschedule it. The employee at the front desk said "Okay! Take care." After I left, it took me 20 minutes to exit from their parking garage for visitors. HR at Newark Beth Israel does not validate parking tickets- they make job applicants pay the $5 parking fee.  The parking garage does not staff the downstairs security booth, and both of the exits were not letting me out. I called the hospital operator, who transferred me to security. Security told me someone would come to the parking garage to let me out. Nobody came. Luckily, a woman who was driving behind me told me how to get around the parking issue and I was able to exit. All of this nonsense for a job interview, for a job that was probably going to pay $15/hour? I'm glad I didn't wait any longer than I did.
Interview Questions: They didn't ask me anything except what time your interview is.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (New Brunswick, NJ) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Group interview, informative, no direct questions. Just an introduction around the table and time and day preferences. Provided a tour in the ED for those interested in ED. Overall, interview experience was relaxed and the interviewer were friendly faces.
Interview Questions: Are you a early bird or like to start day your day late?

title: EMT-B Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview included questions about self and also previous job experience. Scenarios were given and provider had to go through how they would handle each situation, what equipment would be used and where to transport.
Interview Questions: scenario-based questions including trauma and medical.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: HR schedules interviews and communicates hiring  decisions fairly quickly. Interviewers are kind and ask questions to get a sense of who you are and what you can bring to their team. Overall it was a positive experience.
Interview Questions: What is one of your strengths and one of your weaknesses?

title: Rd Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: There were 3 interviews. Standard questions. All went well everyone was really nice and supportive. No random questions, everything relevant with the job. Interview with the manager was the best.
Interview Questions: When do you want to start?

title: Imaging Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: Individual and Group interviews with future co-workers. Very informal and relaxed compared to other hospitals. I'm not sure if this is a good thing or bad thing. Time will tell.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions were asked.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: Apply, get an email about next steps, phone interview, in person interview, one more with department head. Ask about the same questions in each. Ask your own questions. Follow up and thank for time. Wait to hear back.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself please

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process felt like it was good. However, The interviewer barely let me talk he was just going over the job details. I never received a call or an email from their  HR department, so  for them not to reach out and let people know if they got the job or not is very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: He was talking the entire time. Just asked me about my work experience.

title: Surgical Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (New Brunswick, NJ) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The first step was a brief interview with a recruiter. A virtual interview was set up with an office manager. Go to Meeting was the videoconferencing platform and the second interview lasted about twenty minutes. Overall, the experience was favorable.
Interview Questions: How would you develop trust with physicians?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview was straightforward. I interviewed first with HR then the department manager. I was asked questions about my past experience and answered multiple scenario questions. It was an average interview for a huge hospital system.
Interview Questions: How does your past work experience relate to the position you are applying for ?

title: Peer Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: A laid back environment with a good first impression. I met the director and staff and it went very well. I was given a good amount of time to speak and the director really listened. I could tell. Great!
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, what interests you about the job.

title: Childlife Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: I completed a self assessment form and met with Human Resources, nursing leadership, nursing staff, foundation staff, executives and volunteer supervisors.Then met with the medical directors of the facility and had to complete a video interview that lasted an hour.
Interview Questions: What do you do for self care?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Lakewood, NJ) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview  was not professional.  Interviewer was not prepared and kept getting interrupted. I felt like I was doing the interviewing.  They could not give me a written job description.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: It was not awful, but it was lengthy. I was not prepared for an hour-long conversation about myself. I did not have much prior experience so there was not much to say and it made me feel very awkward.
Interview Questions: Describe a negative patient experience and how you handled it.

title: Emergency Medical Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: it is done online and takes time to schedule one. i have to wait about two weeks before i get a virtual interview. not a big deal but it is not immediate hire
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Team Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very simple and easy to get through. I was a former employee at the Somerset campus so I had no issues but as long as you are prepared, you'll do fine
Interview Questions: How do you feel about asking people for money

title: Clinical Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: it was a group interview to get to know each other and more about the job. it was about an hour long. they only asked two questions and then gave more general information.
Interview Questions: what was a difficult situation you were in and how did you handle it

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Use a lot of behavioral questions and scenarios.  Definitely have some situations for all the common topics asked in nursing interviews. Like disagreements with patients, a time you intervened and caught a patient circling the drain ect.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult patient

title: Quality Department Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Somerset, NJ) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was screened by a recruiter first who set up an interview with the director and one other person from her team. It was very underwhelming. They both seemed very stressed and angry. It made me not want to work with them, I'm usually an upbeat person and they were downers. She complimented me on most of my answers but I just never heard back at all. Interviewers should remember that they are getting interviewed too!
Interview Questions: Name a weakness and strength.

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Jersey City, NJ) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick and mainly the basic interview questions. And what type of schedule can you work . A very pleasant interview,because of covid it was virtue but still a good interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself ?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (New Brunswick, NJ) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a virtual due to the covid 19 but alot of questions to be answered only to not get the job. Three managers usually will interview you. They prefer experience.
Interview Questions: Are you a team player? Do you enjoy helping people

title: Therapeutic Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Jersey City, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: Due to covid interviews were held virtually. There was only one interview. Afterwards I was contacted by HR via phone and email with a job offer. This position was per diem working in their group home
Interview Questions:
What is your experience with working with mentally ill people? 
How do you handle crisis situations ?

title: Mental Health Screener Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Belleville, NJ) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview Process was delightful every one at RWJ Barnabas was helpful, forthcoming and informative. Both the Director and Assistant Director provided me with quick and timely updates regarding my status and eligibility.
Interview Questions: Can you name a situation where you had to help a client in crisis?

title: OTR-L Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: First, the hiring manager emailed to set up an interview. Then, the interview was held through voice call that lasted 30 minutes. The hiring manager asked some questions and discussed what the position entailed
Interview Questions: How do you know when to discharge patients to SNFs, vs acute rehab, or other facilities?

title: Patient Monitor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: it was quick and easy just know how to speak and show initiative and you'll get the job . it was a swift process but they make the job seem harder than it is
Interview Questions:
they ask about your life goals
and past experience and why you want to work in a hospital

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: Just be prepared. Do your research on why you want to work for their hospital and be confident. It was standard interview questions and ask questions back. Overall you meet with around 4-6 people for the interview at the same time.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize your patients?

title: Nurse station clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Belleville, NJ) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Short, I was doing the interview when we realized the time they needed from a part-time worker to do orientation for the job (2 weeks) did not align with my schedule at the time.
Interview Questions: Tell me a few things about youself?

title: Clinical Research Analyst Senior- Population Health Analytics Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Somerset, NJ)
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted by HR for a brief screening call and set up to meet with the team on-site. The hiring manager seemed friendly and gave me a team overview, and then asked me more about my background and interest in the role and the company. She then sent in her team of 3 to meet with me: let me be clearer, this was less of a meeting and more of a very disrespectful interrogation. 
They offered their first name (that's all -  no background of what they do, who they are) - and the next comment was "So tell us about you" - and then launching into a stream of technical questions (surrounding SQL, SAS, R, Python). One of the members on the team was nice and understood that people come from different technical stacks, the other was very expressive (triumphant when I couldn't answer one of her questions, and visibly stumped when I answered a particularly tough one, and the third sat as if this was the last place she wanted to be. She continually frowned upon my background, and didn't ask many questions, audibly making it clear that she isn't interested in me and so does not see the point in getting to know me better. 
I left the interview with absolutely no idea about what groundbreaking work these other people do on the team, mind you. I appreciate the hiring manager and the team member who had the decency to be personable during the interview process, but can't really say for the person who just came in to display her lack of interest, and the one who felt she was sent in to triumph over me and took very visible pleasure every time I couldn't answer her (which wasn't a lot of times, thankfully). I take solace in knowing that by the end of the interview, I (the applicant), had lost interest in working with that team altogether. In future, I'd advise them to either screen better so that they don't interview candidates they don't particularly like, or at least project better versions of themselves so that the candidate feels motivated enough to get through the interview and still pictures himself working there. 
I haven't head back from HR yet, but guess what, I'm not even inclined to follow up! 
My best wishes and a heartfelt commendation of bravery to whoever takes up this role - tough task ahead of you!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at RWJBarnabas, and why with Population Health Analytics?

title: Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Philadelphia, PA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The woman who interviews me was nice but it seemed like no one was on the same page. when i was originally contacted by the HR team they said that I would work full time 8-4:30 then during my interview I was told they wouldn't have that and then they offered me 6-3:30 which still isnt bad but then I noticed as the interview went on alot of the stuff i was told prior seemed to not be true and there was just alot of miscommunications.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a transporter?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: The whole process of interviewing and on boarding took about 1 month but was very simple and straightforward.  I meet one on one with the VP on the department and then I meet with th nurse manager. We walked around the unit and she asked me a few questions.  Very casual.
Interview Questions: What is the hardest thing I've experienced while being a nurse?

title: Client Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Toms River, NJ) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: they had me do phone interview first and when they decided if they wanted a second interview, Human Resources would call you in for an in person interview. standard questions of why you want the job, what makes your special for the position
Interview Questions: why do you think you are a good fit for this position

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: Got a call for a phone interview after about two-three weeks. After the phone interview, got an offer the following week. Place seemed like a nice place to work but I guess I was not ready at the time as I had other more attractive job offers.
Interview Questions: Career plans for the future

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by two people, it was through. More of a casual interview as well as to get to know you. They ask a serious of questions as well as questions about your availability and schedule
Interview Questions: How would you deal with an angry family member

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Takes long to get an interview, fairly quick to start. Interviewed with the office manager first and then had to go to follow up interview with regional head before getting hired.
Interview Questions: I don’t really remember. Basic interview questions.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Newark, NJ) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Received an email from HR a few days after submitting an application online through their external applicant portal. Scheduled the interview for the following week. Met with HR first before moving onto the unit to interview with one of the interim nurse managers. Received their decision a few hours later via email and accepted the offer the next day.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the types of patients you would likely see on this floor (post-interventional cardiac unit)?

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers never showed up to phone interviews and HR never followed up. I will not recommend this organization because of how poorly the recruiter handled the interview process.
Interview Questions: What current certifications do you have?

title: Patient Access Representative Toms River Location Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Toms River, NJ) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was told I’d receive my phone interview by the supervisor when she called she called the secondary number not my primary number listed on my application and she called 10 mins prior to the actual interview time. I was expecting a call on my primary contact number and was waiting around for my interview I never received the call. I contacted HR and she rescheduled my phone interview the next day I spoke with the supervisor and the 1st phone interview just asking if you can complete and go to the trainings that 4-5 weeks I told her I had no issues with getting to the trainings or traveling never heard back from her. Applying was such a waste of my time and also having my references submit info about me.
Interview Questions: Any travel plans or vacations the next six months, why do you want to work with community medical, can you travel to the different hospital locations for trainings, can you attend trainings in Edison

title: New Grad Pediatric RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and went to the first interview day. Was then called to come in for a second interview and tour the floor and meet with the managers and staff of that unit. Was offered the job about two weeks after the second interview.
Interview Questions: why do you want pediatrics?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Toms River, NJ) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview with two different individuals, including the HR manager and the director of my department. Average questions were asked in a comfortable, relaxed environment in an office room. On a separate day, I had to get a background check and drug screen prior to being hired. I quickly got a phone call asking if I would accept the position at the rate they provided. I started 1 week after the general orientation.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in an acute care setting?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: Heard back from them a week after submitting my application. Had to get 5 references to fill out an online survey then got an email from nurse recruiter. Got an offer within a week.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose Newark Beth Israel?

title: Physi Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Bridgewater, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by staff or management  . Not see any physician involved . Non professional and rude staff.  A young office manager kept me waiting in the meeting room . No answer after that . Not even a call back or letter . Can’t believe it’s from a well reputation organization .
Interview Questions: Previous job

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (New Brunswick, NJ) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: they had a line of people to interview, asked the basics what days i can work and what time. very impersonal, they just wanted to keep it moving. They did not seem to really care.
Interview Questions: How would you describe yourself in the work environment.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Newark, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: HR reached out via email and we scheduled an interview for the following week. Started with HR first and then went to the unit to interview with the nurse manger and two charge nurses. The HR portion was standard but then it got confusing because he sent the insurance packages via email. The interview with the unit was decent. They asked the standard questions then I was given a scenario.
Interview Questions: Describe why you chose nursing

title: ICU Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Newark, NJ) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview with nurse recruiter, next interview w/ nurse manager and some of the staff nurses on the unit. Be confident and remember you''ll working with them so be yourself and try to connect with them.
Interview Questions: How do you keep your knowledge current?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: I Attended the Open house with same day interview for residency program. I had the interview with the nurse manager of the unit I wanted to persue. Then he referred me to a second interview with the director of the unit. Basic questions were asked. No behavioral questions were asked from all interviewers. Only met the director for 2 mins and then walked with the assistant director and toured me through  the unit  The whole process took less than a  month.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this unit?

title: EMT Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Somerset, NJ) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of various patient scenarios as well as determining correct ways to speak to patients. Medical terminology was also touched upon slightly, but mainly focused on how to treat patients and adapt to their needs.
Interview Questions: Was there a time when you disagreed with a supervisor? How did you solve the issue?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: Very comfortable environment. Interview felt like a conversation. Just relax and you will do fine. Also think of some good questions that you may have to ask them. Good luck
Interview Questions: How long do you plan on staying in this role?

title: CT/Rad Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Somerset, NJ) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: i had a great interview at RWJ Somerset. pleasant and informative lead tech. explained rolls and expected responsibilities. she showed me the entire department and introduced me to the staff.
Interview Questions: why would I want to work there?

title: Housekeeping Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Newark, NJ) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, a few days later I received a phone call to come in for an interview. After a 10 minute interview I was referred to Human Resources to continue in the hiring process. Same day I received a offer on the spot and an email to submit 5 references. About a week and a half later I went in to do a employee health screening and to sign the offer letter. I am currently waiting for orientation which is in two weeks. That will be my first day.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Internal Audit Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Oceanport, NJ) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: There was a Phone interview, followed by two in-person interviews. After acceptance, they bring you in to the hospital for a full physical and ask you to submit references and background check.
Interview Questions: Plans for your future?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: Great interview experience and friendly staff. Very informative with job description and duties. Went over resume and the skills that would be a good fit for the position. Very calm and quiet office setting
Interview Questions: Background in customer service experiences

title: Mental Health Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Newark, NJ) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Initially I applied online and a two weeks later o received an email requesting to input 5 references. I emailed HR and told them it was completed. She emailed me back one day later requesting to schedule an interview. The interview was scheduled for two weeks later. 

Day of the Interview: met with HR where she described the position and I explained my credentials and experience. Once that was completed which took about 10-15 minutes she walked me to the psych unit to meet with the director. The director interviewed me by telling me the functions of the job and asking me for my availability and my experience which was very casual. She then gave me a tour of the facility and introduced me to the staff in all units. After the tour she asked if I would be interested in the position and then told me she would get back to HR. The whole I Interview lasted for an hour and fifteen minutes. 

I am still waiting for an offer or not...the interview was two days ago. So hopefully I get a call.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with children with mental illnesses before ?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Belleville, NJ) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Collaborative teams meet with applicant to determine fit. Team went over various scenarios and discussed applicants role and outcomes in a variety of scenarios. Discussed conflict management. Reviewed educational components involved in educational background and expertise.  Independent evaluations from all team members involved during interview.
Interview Questions: How do I handle conflict in team

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Jersey City, NJ) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Was contacted a month later for an interview. Asked to take online assessment through Prophecy; clinical competence and interpersonal competence, a behavioral assessment, and a skills assessment. Interview itself was straightforward, met with the nurse director of the unit.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stressful situations?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Jersey City, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: First interview was with HR, subsequent interview was a interview with 2 executives.  They were very welcoming and interested in getting the best person for the job.  They were waiting for me in the hallway.
Interview Questions: How would you feel if you had more education that your supervisors.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Belleville, NJ) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews - one with a recruiter who is extremely nice and polite - the next with HR to discuss package. It helps if you know someone - luckily for me, I had a couple of mates who worked the ER and were extremely nice in being a referral to me.
Interview Questions: Very informal - education, BLS, etc - additional certifications

title: NICU Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Kenilworth, NJ) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I went to an open interview. I waited until they called the unit I was applying for. Then I met with 2 of the nurse managers. They took a minute to look at my resume. They were kind, I talked to them for about 20 mins.
Interview Questions: You live in ______ how is the commute for you?

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Jersey City, NJ) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Two people interviewed me and they made me feel comfortable. Although I didn't expect to be interviewed by more than one person, it felt like I was having a normal conversation with them. I came in feeling a little nervous then my nerves went away because they were so nice.
Interview Questions: What was your favorite clinical experience?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Belleville, NJ) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was casual. People really want to know you and your personal goals. They look for good relations with staff and patients which the hospital is known for.
Interview Questions: describe yourself and where do you aim to be in 5 years

title: CPT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Livingston, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: It was a 3 step interview. First i was interviewed by the HR department, and then by two managers of the pathology department. Both interviews were short. Currently waiting for a call back. Apparently, there will be an administrator interview,  and the a peer I interview.
Interview Questions: What's the difference between serum & plasma?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Belleville, NJ) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: met with HR and the director of the department. neither really asked many questions, mostly went over the job responsibilities and asked my available hours. to be fair i had employee referral so that might be why... and a couple others in the department do too
Interview Questions: how do you deal with difficult people

title: Nurse Float Pool Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Newark, NJ) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: i applied online. one week later i got an email for a position i applied for. interview scheduled for the following week. i was asked in input 5 references. i practiced questions from here and other sources in front of the mirror and then in front of a friend.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Newark, NJ) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Submitted resume and application online .  
Called in for interview.  Cordial recruiter .. basic interview questions.  Learned about clinical areas, requirements and benefits. Met with manager of area and discussed clinical expectations.
Interview Questions: Walk through job history

title: Per Diem Financial Clearance Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Toms River, NJ) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied on the RWJBarnabas Health website.  I got called for an interview approximately two (2) months later.  And, although I was nervous, I accepted the interview offer.
Interview Questions: They asked me regular interview questions.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Lakewood, NJ) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: After applying 3 times to the same position that kept getting reposted, I decided to put a fake employee name on the 4th application.  They called to set up interview, had me email a survey to 5 references that had to be completed by my interview-the next day.  All to find out when I got there that the job was only for internal candidates.   I was offered another position but when they finally disclose the pay rate, you realize it was a total waste of time.
Interview Questions: availability/schedule

title: Patient Safety Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Belleville, NJ) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very fluid.  My interview started on time.  It lasted a mere 5 minutes, as the interviewer had all my info in front of them from the application process.   Standard interview questions were asked and I was offered the position on the spot.
Interview Questions: Why would you be a perfect fit for this position?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: Ask if you have previous insurance/ customer service experience. Pretty straightforward. Tries to see whether you are coach-able and pick things up quickly. They put you through an insurance training class followed by 1 on 1 with someone senior. Then they throw you in by yourself. Lots of paperwork to read and become an expert on over night.
Interview Questions: How will I manage work around school?

title: Registration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It took about 20 minutes. They wanted to know about previous experiences, my short term and long term goals, and my availability. In addition, they wanted to know how well I got along with others and how I would handle "difficult" patients
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength?

title: PC Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Jersey City, NJ) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Many questions, making sure I was good with patients. 2 people intervied me, then I eent to HR. Took a written and practical skills test and had a physical. The process took a month, then 2 weeks of orientation.
Interview Questions: Patient needs to use the bathroom but vitals are due what do you do first?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Newark, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for several positions. HR called me to set-up an interview. Interview with HR, then with the manager. First interview, I was informed that they were looking for more experience. Then HR set me up an interview for another unit that they felt I was a better fit. One week after, I was offered the position. Start date was 3 weeks later.
Interview Questions: Why would you want to work for this unit. Describe a situation you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Toms River, NJ) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview with HR- Talent Acquisition first. Second:  Director of Department - both were very helpful in answering my questions. The Director very helpful in regard to questions about acuity, staffing ratios and overall working conditions. Had to return for second interview with department head.
Interview Questions: How many years in mental health had I worked. How do I work under pressure. Am I familiar with EMR.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Oceanport, NJ) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Advertised as a "Job Fair" and it was far from it. When you arrived you were Immediately given a clerical test that had nothing to do with the job you would be performing.  After you finished the test you had to wait a good half an hour until your name was called. There were four groups of managers interviewing one person at a time. They literally shot question after question to each candidate from a scripted piece of paper.
Interview Questions: How do you manage your time when you are given a difficult task?

title: School Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (East Orange, NJ) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was taken on a tour of the school by the principal and told what each room was and that they cook their food,I was asked to come to the school for 2 days to see how the office was run,(I did not get paid for the 2 days I was there.) then principal said she would call me.I didn't hear from her so I sent a thank you email letting her know I was still very interested in the position.
Interview Questions: when was my last day of work at Jersey city Medical Center.

title: Monitor Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Took about an hour and just asked general questions. Goals and what was the purpose of wanting to join the RWJ family. How well do you see your self fitting in. What is something you can bring to the rwj
Interview Questions: What is your reason for applying

title: Financial Clearance Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Toms River, NJ) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was with director of the department and supervisor from one of the 4 teams.  The HR team will extend an offer around the following week.  Need to be up to date on shots, tested for TB with employee health before start date. (This job requires the flu shot)
Start date is typically two to three weeks away following the HR phone call...but it depends on when the next general training session is. Training is at business  office for the first few days.
Interview Questions: What are three of your strengths and three weaknesses? How would you handle an upset customer/patient? Where have you worked before? Tell us about a time that you resolved an issue.  Where do you see yourself in 5 years? Where do you see yourself in 10 years? What are three qualities that your friends would use to describe you?

title: Adjunct Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: Took about two weeks to hear back on online application. Scheduled interview over the phone. In person interview with the department director at the facility, then interviewed with the HR coordinator right after but was offered the option to schedule another appointment with HR coordinator. They gave me a tour of the facility and the department office. They were very accommodating of my requested start date and lined it up with the new hire orientation for the upcoming month.
Interview Questions: What are your greatest strength and weakness?

title: Screener Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Jersey City, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: I met with many people the day of my interview. I was then asked to come in and observe an entire shift for the hours I would be working. The background check was about 6 weeks on its own. Plus all the actual steps of the process. This lengthy application process contributes to high rates of turnover as empty positions cannot be filled in a timely manner.
Interview Questions: Asked if I'd worked nights before

title: EM Residency Interview Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Newark, NJ) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Same process as most EM residency interviews. Showed up in the morning,was greeted by program director and other staff. Had presentation about the program and then three different interviews
Interview Questions:
Why EM 
Why NBI 
Why pick you

title: Study Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. Hired from within. I received a phone call from the hiring manager and completed the paperwork with HR the following week.  It was very easy and it seemed as if I was given the job before the interview was complete.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questionnaires (i.e strengths, weaknesses, team player, etc.)

title: Emergency Room Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Long Branch, NJ) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: A very thorough process from start to finish.  This company has a format in which you have several stages of the interview process, starting with a general interview and then being called back if they are interested to meet with others.  Potentially you can have 4 to 5 interview sessions over a couple of days.
Interview Questions: Credentials are very important to provide

title: Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Toms River, NJ) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: meet with specific personal including current team members ending with tour. started with stated personal describing job position which lead to any questions either by them or me. this was followed by meeting team members who also described position as they are the ones first hand completing. feedback and questions for both parties also presented here.
Interview Questions: identify personal strengths and weaknesses

title: I Can't Say Because the Position Has Bever Been Held Before Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager met me at the elevator. She was polite and extended the interview so that she could answer my questions.  I arrived a few minutes early. The building is very quiet.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current job?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions:
Mail in application isn't too much of a problem, but if you're a school student, there are a few extra hurdles and recommendation letters to jump through. They don't often call you back, so make sure to pay them a visit to ask how the application is moving along.

The interview is only a few standard questions, getting them to process your application at all is the biggest obstacle.
Interview Questions: What makes you interested in working here?

title: Data Center Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (West Orange, NJ) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with my direct supervisor, had a standard interview, no real HR "got ya" questions. Asked my about my IT knowledge and background. Talked to me about the position I also asked about continuing education and if they helped pay for certifications. I was told that they had a couple more interviews to do but I'd hear back by next week. I then got the offer and went through the HR process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your IT knowledge

title: Surgical Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Newark, NJ) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Some of the employees are mean and bitter because the union wont fight for a raise but will continue to take money out the pay check, you pay for parking, just put it this way there are so many things being deducted that you have to get another job to keep your head above water.
Interview Questions: Can you handle difficult people?

title: ED Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Belleville, NJ) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: HR interview first and ER director interview second. Really easygoing interview. Just go in and talk with nursing recruitor and talk about prior experiences. Emphasize compassion and promoting overall health well-being. Then for the ER director interview, repeat the similar guidelines as I said before. Clara Maass is understaffed and they are looking for ER techs.
Interview Questions: Do you know how to take vital signs? What are your future goals in healthcare for the long term? Are you compassionate overall?

title: Patient Safety Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Belleville, NJ) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was nice. The interviewer was very nice and understanding.  Unlike other places that TELL you when you can work, she asked. I had just had a baby, fresh out of school, and on my way back to school. If you're trying to go into the medical field, it's the best place to start.
Interview Questions: She asked if I saw myself growing with the company and what my goals were.

title: Credentialing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: Must take a 100 question test personality test online. Meet with HR, asked basic describe yourself in 3 words, what dont you like ablout job, basic questions. Then sends you to meet with hiring Manager.
Interview Questions: Basic

title: Central Sterile Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Hamilton, NJ) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very fulfilling and positive there's no other word to give my interview experience. So I guess I won't be able to give you the minimum of fifty words as asked for.
Interview Questions: Was given a test on knowledge of instruments. Which I never expected because nowhere else such test was given. Thought it was a very good thing to do.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult or unexpected questions.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Livingston, NJ) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Went quite well. Interviewers asked general questions while assessing if I would be a good candidate for their facility. Overall, the were very professional and inviting. I was asked did I have any weaknesses and if so what?I described that sometimes I can over think things with the idea of plan for the worse believe for the best and that I have worked to overcome this by reassuring myself that I am giving my patients the best care and all have been satisfied so far. This has helped me because I realized that I am no longer in nursing school where we were always drilled to prepare for the worst and to notice the s/s of of impending life threatening circumstances.
Interview Questions: What is one of my weaknesses?

title: Hospitalist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: Excellent work environment. Great place to work.
Interview Questions: There is no unrelevant question.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (West Orange, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: easy, 2 interviews and i had an offer
Interview Questions: why healthcare?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Newark, NJ) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Application looked at grades from university studies then filling out application background check easy process not difficult as long as you applied early. This was just a temporary internship but I found them organized and time appropriate.
Interview Questions: What I wanted to get out of the internship.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Newark, NJ) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a standard nurse interview process. With questions and answers regarding clinical scenarios. Also, customer service based questions such as: "Tell me about a time when you had a difficult patient and what you did to resolve the situation and make sure they were satisfied with the resolution."
Interview Questions: Name a time you made a clinical mistake.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health
Interview Descriptions: an oredeal
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Oceanport, NJ) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview first then called back for two face to face interviews months apart.  The entire process took 4 months.  Some questions were asked that I was astounded were allowed. I have included them in the interview questions below.  I did not speak with HR at all.  On the second interview I really felt like the hiring manager was trying to talk me out of my candidacy.  So I was Very shocked that I got an offer.
Interview Questions: Do you think you can handle New Jersey people?

title: Microbiology Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Trenton, NJ) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions:
The human resources recruiter contacted me, asked me some preliminary questions over the phone, then arranged an appointment for an onsite interview.  The onsite interview with the recruiter comprised the usual questions: he asked about my work experience, why I left my most recent position, and why I was interested in this position for which I was applying.  He briefly discussed salary and benefits, then gave me directions to the main hospital building (Human Resources Department is in a separate building on the hospital campus) for my interview with the department head.
My interview with the department head was a pleasant experience, as she went into detail about the laboratory and her expectations for the person who would be hired for the position.  She also arranged for me to have the opportunity to meet separately with two other lab supervisors, as well as with the Infection Control manager.  Each person who interviewed me was very professional and friendly, giving the impression that they were happy to be working for this employer.
On the day after the interview, the department head telephoned me to ask my impressions of the interview, and whether I felt I would be happy working in this position.  When I indicated that I was still very interested in the position, she told me she would discuss my interview with the HR recruiter.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Newark, NJ) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview went well. The culture at Beth Israel hospital is very open happy and friendly environment.
Interview Questions: How do you like working with minorities

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Meet and greet. One on one interview. Fairly easy, there were no difficult questions. The interviewer got straight to the point about what is expected of the job position being hired for. the experience overall was a pleasant one
Interview Questions:
why do you want to work here?
what makes you a good fit for this position?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Livingston, NJ) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with 2 different people, typical interview. Read the resume and ask questions. Tell me about yourself? Why would you be good for Barnabas health, etc.Your strong points, weak points. Why barnabas health
Interview Questions: Typical HR nonsense

title: Dental Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Newark, NJ) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Not part of match. Interview in front of all attendings.
Interview Questions: None. They try to get to know you as a person.

title: Cat Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Columbus, NJ) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Nothing spectular
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years

title: NICU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at RWJBarnabas Health (Newark, NJ) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: Very casual discussion, and called for hire 3 days later
Interview Questions: none
